cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast, with the center projected to move inland over southeast Louisiana then north-eastward across Mississippi/Alabama.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (near the region between Morgan City and the Mississippi River Delta)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border (includes Mobile Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Sabine Pass TX eastward to the AL/FL border including Mobile Bay and the northern Gulf Coast barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–58 mph) are possible at Mobile beginning late Sunday night or Monday with a 41 % cumulative probability; a 10 % chance exists for 50-kt (58 mph) winds. Hurricane-force winds are currently unlikely but could occur if the track shifts east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; 3–5 ft inundation possible in Mobile Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 in of rain possible along the coastal sections of Alabama with isolated totals up to 16 in, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; a few tornadoes possible in outer rainbands on Monday.
